Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their correct habitats.
The student can draw and label the places where different plants and animals live (e.g., water, forests, fields).
The student can draw and label the resources needed by plants and animals in their habitats (e.g., water, air, sunlight, land resources like soil and rocks).
The student can show the relationships between plants and animals and the materials they need to survive (e.g., fish need water, deer need leaves, plants need sunlight).
The student can demonstrate how the places where animals and plants live provide the resources they need to survive.
The student can display how certain plants and animals are found in specific places because those areas meet their needs (e.g., fish in water environments, deer in forests).
The student can explain through their drawing that plants, animals, and their habitats form a system that works together to meet the needs of the living things.
